task.title: Cross-referencing content, knowledge management implications of managing section numbering and other kinds of sequential numbering
task.shortdesc: Most policy and procedure documents are extensively numbered. This provides for simple cross-referencing, but creates a massive overhead for maintainability of the whole document and, particuarly, reuse of the smaller parts in other related. Without numbering, or where final numbering isn't going to be available to you as an author, focus on the names of elements you will refer to a reference those.

section.p: There is an obvious cost in ease of reference for particular sections. This might cause some difficulty with claiming compliance with particular sections.
There seems to be no real reason whyDITA processing tools could provide optional numbering on the output, but this doesn't seem to be a priority.

section.title: Refer to cross-referenced tables and figures by their name
Give tables and figures useful, long, unique names
